episodes.title: FOG: The Hidden Manipulation Tool That Keeps You Stuck
episodes.description:

episodes.title: Stonewalling: The Silent Weapon of Emotional Control
episodes.description:
Stonewalling is silence turned into a weapon... a manipulation tactic that keeps you anxious, apologizing, and doubting yourself. In this deep-dive, you’ll learn what stonewalling looks like (overt and covert), why toxic people use it, and how to respond without losing your voice. This is emotional abuse in disguise, and it ends when you reclaim your self-trust and clarity.
⚡ Watch until the end for recovery tools and next steps.

⸻

episodes.title: The 4 Stages of Leaving Abuse (PIMI, PIMO, POMI, POMO)
episodes.description:
Leaving a toxic relationship, cult, or high-control group isn’t a flip of a switch—it’s a journey through PIMI, PIMO, POMI, POMO. In this video, I explain each stage with real-life examples, how trauma bonds keep you stuck, and the steps to move toward freedom. If you’ve ever wondered why you can’t “just leave,” this roadmap will help you name your stage, safety-plan, and rebuild your life.

⸻

episodes.title: The Grief Cycle after Narcissistic Abuse & Cults
episodes.description:
Leaving a toxic relationship or narcissistic abuse isn’t the end... it’s the beginning of a grief cycle most people don’t understand.
In this video, I explain the 5 stages of grief (denial, anger, bargaining, depression, acceptance) and why healing is never a straight line.
If you’ve ever wondered why you miss someone who hurt you, this will help you make sense of your emotions and take the first steps toward true healing.

⸻

episodes.title: Thought Terminating Clichés: The Hidden Language of Control
episodes.description:
Uncover the hidden power of thought-terminating clichés... phrases like "just let it go" or "you're overreacting" that shut down your voice and emotions. In this video, Callie Sorensen, a Coercive Control expert, explains what these clichés are, why they’re so effective, and how to respond without losing your truth. Learn to recognize manipulation, trust your intuition, and break free from toxic dynamics.

episodes.title: 8 Ways You’re Being Brainwashed (Lifton’s Thought Reform Explained)
episodes.description:
8 ways people brainwash you using Lifton’s Criteria for Thought Reform. Learn how coercive control, psychological manipulation, and toxic relationships rewire your mind... often without you realizing it.

Psychiatrist Robert J. Lifton identified 8 psychological tactics used in totalitarian regimes to break down and reshape people’s beliefs... what he called thought reform, now known as brainwashing. These same methods show up today in toxic relationships, cults, spiritual abuse, political ideologies, and more. In this video, I explain each tactic and give real-life examples so you can spot the signs of coercive control and protect your mind.

👇 EXPLORE FREE TOOLS & NEXT STEPS:
→ 🎁 Free Resources & More Information → http://linktr.ee/calliesorensen
→ 📅 Book a free 1:1 consultation → https://calendly.com/calliesorensen/introcall

🌱 STAY CONNECTED & KEEP LEARNING:
→ 📱 Instagram: www.instagram.com/calliesorensen
→ 🚩 Red Flag Education Series: www.instagram.com/redflageducation

—

00:00 Introduction to Thought Reform
01:14 Lifton's Eight Criteria of Thought Reform
01:26 Milieu Control: Controlling the Environment
02:45 Mystical Manipulation: Higher Power Claims
04:21 Demand for Purity: The Impossible Ideal
06:29 Confession: Vulnerability as Control
08:39 Sacred Science: Untouchable Beliefs
10:31 Loading the Language: Limiting Thought
12:18 Doctrine Over Person: Belief Over Reality
13:44 Dispensing of Existence: Worthiness and Belonging
15:24 Conclusion: Recognizing and Resisting Control

episodes.title: Understanding Why People Manipulate, Groom & Control Others
episodes.description:
Have you ever wondered why some people groom, manipulate, or coercively control others? It’s not just about power—it starts with unmet emotional needs. In this video, Callie Sorensen, dives into the inner workings of manipulators. You’ll learn how childhood trauma, shame, emotional starvation, and low self-awareness drive people to manipulate others for survival.

If you’ve ever felt drained by someone’s charm or blamed yourself for their manipulation, this video is for you. Understanding these dynamics is your first step toward freedom.


👇 EXPLORE FREE TOOLS & NEXT STEPS:

→ 🎁 Free Resources, Courses & More Information → http://linktr.ee/calliesorensen

episodes.title: Why No Contact is Essential for Healing from Toxic Relationships
episodes.description:
Why is going no contact so hard even when you know the relationship is toxic? In this video, I break down what “no contact” really means, why it’s so emotionally excruciating, and how to survive the crash that follows.

You’ll learn the 8 powerful steps to go no contact, how trauma bonds form, and why even a simple text or social media check can pull you back into the cycle. If you’ve ever gone back to someone who hurt you, this isn’t because you’re weak... it’s because your nervous system was trained to crave the highs and the hope. But there’s a way out.

👇 Dive deeper with free tools & next steps:

▶️ Check out my resources → http://linktr.ee/calliesorensen
▶️ Book a free 1:1 consultation → https://calendly.com/calliesorensen/introcall

07:10 Preparing for the Emotional Crash
08:47 Grieving and Anchoring in Truth
09:17 What to Expect After Going No Contact
10:07 Final Thoughts and Support

Channel Context & Engagement Guidelines
This channel is a professional education space, not a forum for debate or argument.

This space is for:
• Sharing personal experiences and validating survivor stories
• Sincere questions to better understand or apply the content to your life
• Supporting deep inner work and nervous system healing
• Offering tools and language to name and move through relational harm

What’s not welcome:
• Dismissing or denying lived experiences
• Disrespect, deflection, or bullying (even subtly)
• Comments lacking self-reflection, openness, or curiosity

Comments should be:
• Respectful
• Relevant
• Aligned with the educational and healing intent of this space

Disrespectful or derailing posts will be removed, or responded to in a way that reflects the energy they carry, to demonstrate boundaries in action and offer a learning opportunity for others.

This is not about shaming, but about modeling strength, self-respect, and clear-eyed engagement in the face of manipulation or projection. It’s part of the work.

The content of these videos is for educational purposes only and is not a substitute for therapy or professional advice.

episodes.title: What are Smear Campaigns and Reputational Abuse?
episodes.description:
REPUTATIONAL ABUSE IS A FORM OF EMOTIONAL ABUSE that most people never see coming — until it’s too late. When someone rewrites your story, spreads lies, turns people against you, and makes you look like the problem, that’s not gossip. That’s a smear campaign, and it’s strategic, controlling, and devastating.

In this video, trauma-informed relationship and coercive control specialist Callie Sorensen breaks down exactly what reputational abuse looks like — from overt lies and online shaming to whispered implications and fake concern. You’ll learn:

✅ What smear campaigns really are
✅ Why narcissists and abusers do it
✅ The psychological impact of reputational harm
✅ How to respond (and when not to)
✅ Steps to rebuild your sense of identity and peace

episodes.title: The 6 Stages of Adult Grooming | How Manipulation Happens Slowly
episodes.description:
What are the 6 stages of adult grooming? Learn how grooming happens step-by-step... from trust and emotional dependency to isolation, control, and abuse. Spot the red flags before it’s too late.

Adult grooming is often misunderstood because it’s subtle, strategic, and emotionally disorienting. In this video, I walk you through the 6 psychological stages of grooming—from the early signs of attention and trust-building to the breakdown of your boundaries, isolation, and emotional control.

Whether you’ve experienced grooming in a relationship, spiritual community, workplace, or family system, this breakdown will help you:

 • Understand how grooming actually works in adults
 • Spot red flags before they become abuse
 • Reclaim your clarity and name what happened
 • Rebuild your self-trust and emotional freedom

If you’ve ever felt confused, manipulated, or emotionally entangled with someone who once made you feel safe—this video is for you.

episodes.title: When "God Told Me To" becomes Control | 10 Red Flags of Spiritual Abuse
episodes.description:
“God told me to…” can be spiritual guidance—or a tactic of control and spiritual abuse. Learn how to spot spiritual manipulation, reclaim your boundaries, and reconnect with your own inner truth and discernment.

It might sound like divine guidance, but when it’s used to control, pressure, or override your voice, it becomes spiritual manipulation.

I’m Callie Sorensen, a trauma-informed coach with a Master’s in the Psychology of Coercive Control. I help people heal from spiritually abusive relationships, high-control groups, and the lasting effects of coercion masked as faith.

In this video, we’re breaking down 10 red flags to look out for when someone uses phrases like “God told me,” “Spirit gave me a download,” or “You’re out of alignment with the universe” as tools of control rather than connection.

You’ll learn:
 • Why “God told me” is often used to shut down consent
 • How this language triggers fear, guilt, or urgency
 • How to recognize the internal red flags (in your body and spirit)
 • What to say when you’re pressured by spiritual authority
 • And how to reclaim your voice, your boundaries, and your direct connection to God

If you’ve ever felt confused, guilty, or spiritually silenced, you’re not alone—and you’re not crazy. You’re allowed to slow down. You’re allowed to question. You’re allowed to trust what you feel.

👇 Download my free Feelings & Needs Cheat Sheet below to help you name what’s happening inside: https://preview.mailerlite.io/preview/788475/sites/153661701666899570/AwqeKM

episodes.title: Look out for these Spiritual Abuse Manipulation Tactics 🚩
episodes.description:
This video explores the topic of spiritual abuse and the red flags to look out for in spiritual relationships, spiritual communities, churches, and religious groups.

Spiritual abuse is a form of manipulation and control that can occur in any type of spiritual or religious setting or relationship. It can take many forms, such as emotional manipulation, financial exploitation, or psychological abuse. It is often perpetrated by those in positions of authority, such as spiritual leaders, who use their power and influence to exploit and control their followers.

I share some examples from the spiritual cult that I was apart of and examples from my clients who were in religious cults or toxic spiritual or religious relationships.

This video will help you recognize the warning signs of spiritual abuse, including manipulation tactics and control used by spiritual and religious cults, and take action to protect yourself and your loved ones. Whether you're looking to deepen your spiritual understanding or create a safe and healthy environment for growth and connection, this video is a must-watch. It will help you identify red flags and understand how to protect yourself from spiritual abuse.

Make sure to check out PART ONE - where I share 10 more manipulation tactics that is used in the toxic spirituality field: https://youtu.be/Dv_DIE3G1ko
